front.title: Short Term Requirements for Network Asserted Identity

abstract.t: There is no requirement for identities asserted by a UA in a SIPmessage to be anything other than the user's desired alias.A Network Asserted Identity is an identity initially derived by a SIPnetwork intermediary as a result of an authentication process. Thisdraft describes short term requirements for the exchange of NetworkAsserted Identities within networks of securely interconnectedtrusted nodes and to User Agents securely connected to such networks.
